column1: You can get abdominal abscesses because you have: - A burst appendix - A burst intestine - A burst ovary - Inflammatory bowel disease - Infection in your gallbladder, pancreas, ovary or other organs - Pelvic infection - Parasite infection You are more at risk for an abdominal abscess if you have: - Trauma - Perforated ulcer disease - Surgery in your belly area - Weakened immune system Germs may pass through your blood to an organ in your belly.
